snippet: Violence caused by the drug war in Mexico may be abating, making it the first decline in six years, according to figures released by the government this week.
abstract: Mexican government releases figures that show violence caused by drug war may be abating; data shows a modest decline in homicides in 2012, first in six years.
lead_paragraph: Violence caused by the drug war in Mexico may be abating, making it the first decline in six years, according to figures released by the government this week.

headline.main: A Modest Decline of Homicides in Mexico
headline.print_headline: Mexico: A Modest Decline in Homicides
